dialogue.raw_text: You're positively maudlin. You should be happy. Do you have any idea what you've accomplished?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... but I was working so hard, I didn't realize I'd have no one to share it with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I don't suppose we could turn back the clock for a night and you could come home with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Right. Sorry. Too much champagne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was that about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. It's just... He is who he is. Sometimes I just have to be reminded.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frustrated sighs all around the room.

dialogue.raw_text: To successful phase-shift a human being out of quantum sync with the visible universe and then return him safely, with no after affects.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Well, we found out sending them to "never-never-land" was easy, it's the getting back that's hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Every time we've tried to bring a test subject back from phase-shift. Cellular bonds would dissolve, the primary DNA strands would decay. But now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) But now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But now... (pause) But now, we feel we are closer than ever to resolving this issue. We've been experimenting with a new regression formula that looks rather promising.

dialogue.raw_text: leans forward.

dialogue.raw_text: Sir?

dialogue.raw_text: Keep your voice down.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What do you think they'd do if they know we could send a subject into phase shift and pull it back out again? How many seconds would it take for them to take over the whole project, bringing in their soldiers to test the formula on. We'd have lost control of it by the end of the week.

dialogue.raw_text: It's their money, Sebastian. It's going to happen eventually.

dialogue.raw_text: I know. But not yet. There's too much for us to learn. I don't want my hands tied by their political agenda when we go to phase three.

direction.raw_text: ... on myself. The team sits around the conference table. Their jaws drop and they stare at him with wide eyes.

dialogue.raw_text: Are you nuts?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Pretty sure he was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And remember, for every Jonas Salk, there are a bunch of guys who aren't famous cuz they died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we're that unsure, how can we morally justify testing it on someone else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't it a little soon to be moving into phase three anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's right. We haven't even finished collating the phase two research.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll have plenty of time to collate and cross-reference later. Monkey data doesn't matter anyway. The only real data is human data.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't even know if any of the protocols will work on humans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How are we gonna find out? Besides, we've succeeded with a gorilla and their DNA is 98% the same as humans. And the 2% is not that significant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian ... humans can talk, build houses and cook in microwave ovens. Gorilla's live in trees. That's a helluva 2% if you ask me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're all concerned. I know that. But if we're gonna move forward ever, this is something we have to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why you? Why not one of us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The risks. I couldn't ask...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) What if we volunteer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if you're too valuable to lose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm Project Leader. It's my formula and my call. The best way to express your concern is to make damn sure you do your best work. I'll want about four weeks to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To put your affairs in order?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To run some more reversions and tissue tests and then we'll attempt the phase shift. I'll stay shifted for three days of testing and then we'll perform a quantum regression.

dialogue.raw_text: We made our deal with the devil years ago. Might as well stick around to cash in.

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You really can't see me. Can you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gimme symptoms. Dizziness, nausea, headache, body-ache, disorientation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, just tired. (beat) It's funny. I can see everything... more than before... but I can't see myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carter, Frank, Janice and Sarah work at various research stations. The door opens and Linda and Matt enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda motions to the gap between her and Matt. The four of them stare at the nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn round. The voice is coming from behind them. The group rises from their various workstations and turn toward where the voice came from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rheostat switch on the wall turns and the lights dim. Though it's a simple act, it feels somewhat ominous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda's explanation puts everyone at ease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian has moved. As everyone turns toward him again, he can't stifle a slight giggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice again come s from somewhere else in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank pulls on a pair of THERMAL GOGGLES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. How's he doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you ask him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian, how do you feel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not to bad, considering.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Odd, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can't close his eyes so they're sensitive to light.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, what was it like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon Sebastian. Knock it off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry. Couldn't resist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel like we're playing Marco Polo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I see the procedure hasn't changed your personality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No worries. I'm on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - Every body in the laboratory shows up as a heat signature, including Sebastian. Frank points.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Gotcha, big man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - The HEAT SIGNATURE reaches for a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chair slides back from a desk and bends under Sebastian's weight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, you people have no sense of humor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Show me. So ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank and Janice shuttle the playback controls as a VIDEO MONITOR re-plays various angles of Sebastian's phase shift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank halts the tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janice scribble the numbers in her notebook. Linda crosses, nursing a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heavy sigh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Index that. That was when it started burn. Epidermal reaction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Index Mark. 112125.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's late. Time you got some rest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a little longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hate to pull rank, but you're my patient now and you need rest. We've got a busy day tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Linda enters she points to a small camera in the upper corner of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's clear she does. But she's certainly not going to admit it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We've set up a thermal camera for observation and I've arranged one of us to be here 24/7 in case you need anything. The team's gonna be on alpha- call alert for the duration. If anything goes wrong, we can all be here within...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thirty minutes. Yes,,_I know. I wrote the procedure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was trying to be reassuring.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You like this don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Being in charge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please. I'm just doing my job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON: A video screen. A thermal lump lays stretched out on the bed. Pull back to reveal SARAH staring at the screen. We are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bank of monitors display the various angles of the Hall of Habitats, the laboratory and, of course, Sebastian in the recovery room. Linda hands Sarah a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the glass wall, Linda sees Matt knocking and waving her out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You gonna be okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. It's not like I have anything else going on in my sad pathetic life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carter'll be in at six to spell you and I'll be in by nine. Call me if anything happens, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine. Go on ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The rest of the team straggles into the elevator. Yawning. Exhausted from the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda catches Matt's eye. Gives him a look. "You coming over?" Matt nods, "yes", imperceptible to everyone but Linda. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Man, I'm tired. That was a long day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Days only get longer from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Deserted and dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Late. Sarah rubs her temples. Her eyelids are heavy. She's having real trouble staying awake. The buzzing fluorescent light isn't helping either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sheets ruffle and the indentation disappears from the bed. We can hear breathing and soft sound of bare feet shuffling against linoleum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S toward the door, as if we, are following someone walking. The door handle turns and the door pushes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Hallway of the Habitats. We hear the sounds of sleeping creatures. A couple of them growl at something unseen. The growling follows the invisible something as it passes by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The laboratory door opens and shuts again. Ghostly. We see papers shuffling at one of the work stations. A glass moves slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah reclines in her chair. Fast asleep, Behind her is the glass wall, revealing the empty hallway behind it. But a small portion of the glass fogs, as if someone had just breathed on it. As the fogged part quickly clears, we see the door to the observation room quietly open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still sleeping. We hear a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her heavy breathing mixes with Sebastian's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah's hair moves slightly, as if a hand were running through it. And then we see her shirt move, like fingers were tracing over it. Down from the shoulder to her breast. Around her nipple. Sarah moans slightly, as if she were dreaming, but she doesn't stir. And then her breasts cup slightly, as if they were being touched... softly... gently. Her breathing becomes harder, more labored, erotic... and then she... BOLTS AWAKE. Bar eyes wide with fear. She jumps and cups her own breasts and looks around the room. It's empty, of course. She jumps over to the monitor and checks on Sebastian's room. The heat signature isn't there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She listens. It's silent. She tries holding her breath, listening for his breathing. But there's nothing. Sarah reaches over to a microphone. Hits a few switches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Sarah. Are you awake?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (barely audible) Hmm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Caine! Goddamnit, Dr. Caine! Are you in here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Dr. Caine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - LABORATORY SARAH (V.0.,LOUDSPEAKER) Dr. Caine, please report in. - HALLWAY OF HABITATS SARAH (V.0.,LOUDSPEAKER) Dr. Caine, report in please!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah waits. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks around the room. He must be in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. No response. Sarah waves her hand around, reaching out, trying to find him. After a few beats she stops and rubs her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Sarah gets an idea. She quickly exits the observation room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Dr. Caine? Sebastian? Come on, this isn't funny. I know you're in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I must be going crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At a wall storage box, she removes a pair of Thermal Goggles and slips them on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah enters wearing the thermals. She scans the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - The room is empty. She pulls the goggles off in frustration, and when she glances over at the video screen, she sees Sebastian's thermal image lying on the bed in the recovery room. Sarah sinks into her chair, a tad disconcerted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda and Matt finish listening to Sarah's story.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I found him later in the lab, running samples.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you call me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I wasn't sure. I'm still not. I mean, I could've easily been dreaming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't sound like something Sebastian would do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, I feel so stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I mean... (she torn, unsure of herself) It was probably nothing. I shouldn't've mentioned it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'm sure. I mean, y'know, why would he do that, right? Just, this place at night can be kinda creepy, y'know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sebastian, wearing surgical scrubs sits in an examination chair. Wire leads sprout from the electrodes covering his head and arms. The electrodes seem to outline his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Sebastian talks, we can see the electrodes around his jaw pump up and down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machines pump out EEG, EKG readouts. Matt studies them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, how was your first night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Restless. Hard to sleep when you can't close your eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? What'd you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got up a couple of times. Knocked about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, Sarah mentioned you weren't in your cubicle. She said she called you over the intercom and you didn't respond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess I didn't hear. I had the radio on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'd be helpful to us if you'd tell whoever's on duty where you're going to. I mean, if something were to happen, we'd want to know where to find you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't think it was a problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't. I just don't want it to become one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Readings are normal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next I want to run a VV and UVF analysis of the platelets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll have to draw some more blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Sarah rolls up Sebastian's sleeve, revealing empty air. She wraps a bungee cord around the nothing, pulls it tight and sprays the inside of his elbow with dye. She acts very self conscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The surface of his skin sheens in the light as Linda searches for a vein. She slaps his arm several times, then plunges a hypodermic needle into his skin. His skin bends and gives. The needle remains in sight after it slips through the visible surface. Sarah presses down on the hypo plunger, releasing a dye into his bloodstream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The red dye twists into a long snaking red tube up and down his arm. His vein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah draws the plunger back, sucking Sebastian's blood into the hypodermic and then yanks the needle out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah pulls the vial off the needle and labels it with a grease pencil. After a few beats the red dye in Sebastian's blood stream dissolves and disappears, as does the liquid in the vial.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just seem a little nervous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I...I'm fine. Hold still. This might hurt a bit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Dr. Caine... this might sounds stupid, but are you... are you looking at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I was looking at the clock. Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just felt like someone was staring at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: INT. MRI ROOM MATT slides Sebastian's sheet covered frame into an MRI. Even though his head is not visible, it shown up on the MRI scanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SARAH lower a harness into a water tank. SEBASTIAN'S BODY displaces the water, revealing an empty body shaped cavity in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sips a BIG GULP and stares at a monitor which shows two eat signatures in the Recovery Chamber, huddled over a chess game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on a chessboard... A BLACK KNIGHT takes WHITE BISHOP, seemingly all by itself. Across the table, Matt leans back and topples his WHITE KING acknowledging defeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dim lights. Janice and Frank both don eye guards. Frank switches on a low intensity laser on and it's beam shoots across the room. The beam distorts slightly in the center of the room. As Frank widens the spectral pattern, suddenly the beam splits into a million different spectral rainbows, momentary illuminating Sebastian's entire frame in a glowing tingle of light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls vials from the cyclotrons and props blood sample slides. She slips them under the microscope. She takes a sip of her Diet Coke and puts it on the table. She pears into the microscope and analyses the blood sample, squeezing more stain onto it. She looks up to make notations, but when she reaches for her Diet Coke IT ISN'T THERE. She looks around. It's on the other side of her microscope. She shrugs it off, she takes a sip and sets it down where it was before. She peers into the microscope again and when she looks up... the Diet Coke is gone. She looks around the room and sees it on another table completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear Sebastian's laughter echo in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see indentations on her shoulders where his fingers press down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda pulls away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda walks away. Sebastian laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian? Goddamnit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've no idea how much fun I've had. I'm going to hate going back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what worries me.?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happens when we turn the project over to the Army. Ever wonder how much fun they're gonna have?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we won't give it to them. His voice comes from behind her now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I was thinking... tonight's my last night. Ever fantasize about making love to an invisible man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it, Sebastian. It's not funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, don't do it for me. Do it for science.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Grow up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh well. Missed your big chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got some sleep. Big day tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A bevy of activity below us as the scientists prepare. Matt slides the antigen cocktail into the centrifuge and starts it spinning. A sheet drapes over a Sebastian's frame, straps across his limbs. He is fully wired. Linda looks up to the observation booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank peers down at her from the booth, his voice echoing through the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt removes the glowing vial of orange liquid from a centrifuge nearby. Carter hands Matt a hypo. Matt jabs it into the vial, drawing up the colored liquid. Linda sprays Sebastian's arm with dye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt inserts the hypo into the vein and presses down on the plunger. The liquid begins to react. Small flashes of light blip up and down the strand of color outlining the vein. Ba-bump.. ba-bump... the heartbeat starts to speed up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Recording?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Recording. Subject Doctor Sebastian Caine. Currently in phase shift... Three days, seven hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: De-Phase protocol. Injecting Serial Protein Caine One Two Seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not really. I was just starting to enjoy myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, man. Here we go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait... something... something doesn't feel right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heartbeat elevated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Janice and Frank look over the equipment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Vitals still nominal..
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The glowing liquid turns from gold to red as the complex webbing of a bloodstream appears. Spreading out from the bloodstream, soon becomes visible ... the shadow of a skeletal system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian begins wheezing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muscles are beginning to appear. And eyeballs. Frightened eyeballs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian pulls against his bonds. One set tears off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter grabs onto the mass of flesh and muscle, trying to hold it back. But the restraints snap. The half-visible man is screaming. He grabs Carter and throws him across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just for a second, Sebastian is fully visible. And free. He looks around like a scared animal and rips off all the wiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah preps a tranquilizer. Sebastian locks eyes with Linda. He's lost, he doesn't know where he is. And suddenly, he crumbles to the ground. Linda rushes over to him and puts bar hand on his shoulder. Light bleeds from his skin and his skin begins to dissolve from sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt, Linda and Sarah pull the shifting body up and onto an operating table. Carter pulls himself up and heads back to the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter locates Sebastian's heart, not a difficult thing because we can actually see it. Carter's hand pushes down in the air inches above the heart. We see the heart being pushed and squeezed. Sarah slaps an air bag on Sebastian and starts pumping air into his lungs. Sebastian's heart begins to beat again, beat on its own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We slowly FADE OUT to the sights and sounds of our scientist- doctors working on Sebastian... And the beeping of Sebastian's erratic heartbeat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't br... br...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not breathing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Subject manifesting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pulse erratic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Sebastian! Sebastian!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Sebastian!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get a tranq. Stat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's reverting. Got him on the table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Get me a I.V. of A.G. seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got no pulse. No pulse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Start CPR.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Getting a pulse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holy shit. What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian... can you hear me? Can you hear me? How are his pupils?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't see his goddamn pupils!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he's going into shock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The heartbeat continues. In the shadows, two Rhesus Monkeys defend themselves against an unseen attacker. Blood splatters against the Plexiglas wall. We FADE OUT AGAIN...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda stares through the Plexiglas walls into the Recovery Chamber. Inside the Chamber, Sarah and Carter- eye the various screens monitoring Sebastian's vitals. Linda watches the hollow pocket underneath the blanket. She watches the rhythm of its rises and falls as Sebastian sleeps. Matt comes up behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda exhales in relief. Matt puts his hands on her shoulder. Pulls her close to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda pushes through the door of the recovery chamber and takes a seat by Sebastian's bedside. A little hurt, Matt heads down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just got the tissue sample results. Cellular cohesion is stable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) How bout you? You gonna be okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guess so. (beat) I was just thinking about the Apollo missions. Y'know? Grissom, White and Chaffee... What it was like for them on that launch pad that day, thinking they were gonna reach the stars only to burn to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sometimes the test pilots make history. Sometimes the planes crash and people die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he didn't die, did he? (beat) What if we can't bring him back? What then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just a little hitch is all. He'll be the first to tell that he'll crack it and I'm sure he will. It'll just take time. (beat) Listen, let's got out of here. We could drive up to the old observatory. We'll take some wine and go count the stars and forget all this for awhile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I want to be here for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank and Janice are staring into their coffee when Matt enters. Matt crosses to the coffee machine and pours himself a cup. He takes a seat at the table. They all drink their coffee in silent vigil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda sits by Sebastian's bedside, listening to the constant rhythm of the machines. The sheets shift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian's voice is weak and strained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (weak) Hey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So I guess it didn't work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look worried. It must've been bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You almost died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, remember your Nietchze. Whatever doesn't kill me, makes me stronger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should be making you feel better. Not vice versa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess if I'm going to be stuck this way for awhile, I'd better make some adjustments.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In a dusty shaft of light... A cotton swab. is dipped by a gloved hand into a jar of flesh-colored cream make-up. We follow the hand as it raises the cotton swab into the darkness. The swab strokes over the black and the rich fleshy cream spreads, revealing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of a closed eye. The eyelids part, unveiling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Blink. Blink. No eye. Not even a trace of a eye socket. Just darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: floats through mid-air... hovering before the eyelids. It turns and fastens itself to the darkness between the lids. We PULL BACK slowly as Sebastian lifts a latex FACE MASK and pulls it over his head. He checks his reflection in the mirror. He looks almost human. Almost. A face, eyes, hands ... the rest of him covered by surgical scrubs. We pull back and see the rest of the team looking on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian rises. He looks eerily removed from reality with his cold blank expression.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not too bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The latex'll limit the amount of light delivered to my optic nerves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could almost pass for human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it gives you a face to talk to at least, and we can all work in normal light again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carter draws blood from Sebastian. Samples are placed into the cyclotron. Matt peers through the eyepiece of a microscope. He makes notes. Frank and Janice finish a computer simulation on a protein strand. Matt looks over. They shake their heads, no. Sebastian slides into the MRI. Linda examines a petri dish. She throws her pencil down in frustration. Sebastian is hit by the spectral radiation beams. Matt pulls a vial of orange liquid from the cyclotron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian, still in his latex and scrubs, but looking like he's been dragged through the nine levels of purgatory, is escorted back to the recovery chamber by Linda and Matt. He crosses to his bed and collapses on it. Closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda and Matt exchange a glance. Linda quickly covers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The testing's making me sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could be the barium or the radiation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're physiology has changed and, well, all bets are off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe I have to spend another night here. (to Linda) Suppose you're gonna go home now, meet up with that boyfriend of yours now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want me to stay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. That's okay. It's just, being a guinea pig is more work than I thought. I'll be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Various shots of the empty hallways and deserted labs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter kicks back in his chair listening to his walkman stereo and playing gameboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian, in scrubs and make-up, paces back and forth. He slams the wall in frustration. He crosses to a mirror and examines himself. He doesn't look half bad. He pokes his cheeks. There's something about him that's a little off, but only if you look close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shadow falls across Carter's face. He looks up. It's Sebastian wearing street clothes - jeans and a hooded sweatshirt over his latex mask. Carter pulls of his earphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian turns back into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter scrambles to his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Dr. Caine. What's up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just stopped by to let you know, I'm going out for a bit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Going out? Hey wait a sec!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carter catches up with Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian hits the elevator button. The doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors close with Sebastian inside. Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter runs down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean going out for a bit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I don't get out of here, I'm gonna go crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're not supposed to leave the compound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the rule.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but I made that rule. It's my rule and I'm changing it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't just change it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carter, I was suppose to be like this for three days. Three fucking days and I'll be damned if I'm going to spend the rest of my life as a prisoner in this godforsaken dump. Now I'm going out. I'll be back in a couple of hours. Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carter picks up the phone and dials. A beat then.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, it's Carter. We got a problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors open and Sebastian pushes past the Marine Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian keeps his face turned away as he crosses to his Porsche.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian starts his car. It chugs a few times before turning over and speeding out of the warehouse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Doc. Haven't seen you for awhile?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well. You know how it in sometimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got that right, sir. I was beginning to worry 'cause your car hadn't moved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, but everything's cool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The door opens and Sebastian switches on the lights. He looks around his apartment and sighs. It's good to be home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian enters the bedroom, clicking on the light. He looks at the ceiling, "You Should Be Working", and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda and Matt each rush to their respective cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt tries to give her a quick pack. Linda backs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They get in their cars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He could be anywhere. Hell he could be right behind us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll meet you at the lab. I'm gonna swing by his place, just in case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly, looking around) I don't want him to see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking around too) What a mess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sebastian packs up a few personal belongings in an overnight duffle. He crosses to his bookcase and pulls out some books and throws them into the bag. But as he does, he notices a light come on in the window across the courtyard. Sebastian turns off his bedroom light and moves toward the window. He peers across the courtyard into the Brunette's apartment. He watches the Brunette as she comes into the living room from her front hallway. She drops her keys on the table and begins unbuttoning her blouse as she crosses to the window. Just as the blouse slips off her shoulder, she pulls her blinds shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frustrated, Sebastian steps away from the window and then stops. Something has occurred to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down and notices his hand is trembling. His breathing is a little heavy. A little nervous. He catches a glimpse at himself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Brunette's living room light switches off and the bathroom light switches on. We see him fighting an internal battle and we see him lose it. He grabs a hold of his hand and peels the latex skin off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Don't even think it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (almost whispering) Once...just once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Linda drives Sebastian's apartment. She spots his black Porsche in the parking lot. She pulls over to the curb, jumps out of her car and heads into the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wearing just a robe, the brunette turns on her shower. The doorbell rings. With a frustrated sigh, the brunette rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She peers through the peep hole. No one's there. But as she turns she hears the doorbell again. She opens the door, steps out into the hallway and looks around. Empty. Puzzled she heads back inside her apartment. We follow her as she crosses to her bedroom, but a moment later, the bedroom door closes on its own. We hear a SCREAM come from the other side. Then another. Then a muffled struggled. And we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda exits the elevator and heads down to Sebastian's door. She knocks. Waits. No answer. She knocks again. Waits. And then she tries the door. It's unlocked. She pushes the door open.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Linda pushes through the living room, into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She notices that the bathroom light is on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sebastian?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On the floor she finds Sebastian's clothing and on the vanity she sees his latex face and hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She scramble for the bedroom phone and quickly dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she hangs up the phone, and heads out. The CAMERA doesn't follow, but instead pushes through the blinds and out the window. As we cross the courtyard, we begin to hear muffled cries of terror. We hold on the Brunette's window as we...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Yeah, Matt, it's me. He was here. No. He's taken his make-up off. I don't know...He must be outside somewhere. I don't know where he went. I'm coming back to the lab. How? How'm I supposed to do that? I CAN'T FUCKING SEE HIM! We're going on alpha call.  I want everyone at the lab now. We're gonna need thermal visors and we may need tranqs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The bedroom door opens and we see the Brunette, nude and curled up on the bed, sobbing. We follow the sounds of heavy breathing to the front door of her apartment. The door opens and we push out into the hallway. We can see indentations of feet appear on the hallway carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors open and Linda steps inside. The doors close shut behind her. A beat later we see the indentations of footsteps come around the corner. We follow the breathing and stumbling footfalls back into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We push over to the bathroom sink. The faucet turns on and the water starts running. We see the water cup under the faucet and splash against Sebastian's face. His face appears briefly in the water. Then the water slips away. For second it sounds like he's crying, but then we hear something far worse. He's laughing. Nervous laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matt hands out thermal goggles, while Frank loads and passes out tranquilizer guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all turn around. At the door is Sebastian, back in his latex outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caught dead to rights, Sebastian sinks into his chair. He thinks she knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian realizes that they don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long beat. Sebastian slowly rises, acknowledges Linda with a nod and leaves the room. Linda looks around at her silent co-workers, the goggles and tranqs still on the table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are the tranqs for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Use your imagination.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you saying he's dangerous?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're just saying we need to be cautious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Metro stops running after midnight and he's on foot, so he can't have gotten too far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, this isn't a monkey we're talking about. It's Dr. Caine. Don't you think you're over reacting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This program is classified. If he's out there it means someone might find out about him. He could destroy the whole program.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax, Linda. No one's gonna find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell have you been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a little stir crazy, so I went to my apartment to pick up some stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit! I went to your apartment and I happen to know you did a helluva lot more than pick some stuff up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, of all people How could you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You put yourself and this project at risk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just what did you see in my apartment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw your face and your clothes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was bad enough you left without an escort, but to take off the... (he motions to his face) out in public?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't make a mountain out of molehill. I didn't let anyone see me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not good enough. When you're outside the lab there are a thousand variables none of us can control. It's just not safe for you to be out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Linda. You don't expect me to be some kind of prisoner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You volunteered for this, Sebastian. You knew going in there could be consequences. (beat) For the security of this project, I'm gonna have to ask you to confine yourself to the compound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm still Project Leader, Linda. It's my decision to make.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right. It's your decision. But if you leave the compound again, I'll notify the oversight committee. Then they can make the decision. You understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Matt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, man. You'd do the same if it were the other way around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pack 'em up... Everyone go home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Lab is buzzing with the usual activity. Linda rolls up Sebastian's sleeve, revealing nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wraps a bungee cord around the nothing and pulls it tight. She then sprays the inside of his elbow with dye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The surface of his skin sheens in the light as Linda searches for a vein. She slaps his arm several times, then plunges a hypodermic needle into his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda presses down on the hypodermic plunger, releasing a dye into his bloodstream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knocks her arm away and pulls the hypo, out of his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian looks around at the other scientists staring at him. He tosses the hypo with the needle onto the instrument tray and heads toward the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold still.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (contentious) How much blood do you think you've taken so far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not enough to worry about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every day... feels like you're sucking me dry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's funny. All these years I've known you, I never pegged you for a megalomanic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The shoe being on the other foot. You getting to run things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't ask for this, Caine. But when a classified experiment disappears in the middle of the night, someone's gotta run the show. (tries sympathy) Look, I know how hard this has been for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't patronize me. (beat) And for the record, you've got no idea what it's like. I get up every morning and you people stick needles in me. You bombard me with radiation until I vomit. And then at six it's over for you. You get to go home. But Sebastian is still here. Sebastian can't leave, or else. That's the worst part, you know. Here I have this ... this GIFT and I can't even use it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now it's a gift?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're goddamn right it's a gift. And if you weren't so goddamned short sighted, I'd be out there right now trying to master it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where're you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like I'm going nowhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, man. We've got a ton of tests scheduled today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do them yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Linda enters to find Sebastian reading the collected works of T.S. Elliot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda looks over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the books down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Want to talk about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "We are the hollow men, the stuffed men, headpieces filled with straw."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Funny, huh? I've become a literal metaphor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to fight you. I just want what's best for the program.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. And you being right doesn't make it any easier for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can be scared. That's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not scared of being stuck this way. With a little more make-up and practice, I could... (he motions to his face) ... pass. Y'know, get by in the world. But the testing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're talking like you've given up. It's only been a few months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if it's years? I don't know how much more testing I can take.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sebastian paces back and forth, glancing at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda, Matt and Sebastian, in latex and scrubs, stare at an electron microscope's video display. On the screen in a sparse colony of blood calls but every second more and more cells appear, filling the gap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others in the lab listen. They start to get excited. Janice and Carter leave their research and come over to watch the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They wait. Linda points to a blank patch on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the blood cells nearest the blank patch twinkle out existence, and then those around them also blink away until after a beat, the screen is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian picks up a glass beaker and hurls it against the wall. It shatters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs more equipment and begins tossing it in a rage. Carter and Janice grab him and restrain him. After struggling against them a beat or two, Sebastian calms down and pushes away from them and heads out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We've got it. We've got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all we need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, baby. Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Full quantum cascade at 95%. (beat) I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're sorry? You're fucking sorry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Six weeks of this shit and you're sorry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't blame him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll go talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave him alone. He just needs to blow off some steam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Sebastian lies in his bed, staring at the security camera. The camera stares back at him. As if from a dream, we hear the Brunette's muffled scream and cries for help. As we push in on Sebastian's cold eyes, we can barely make out her face thrashing back in forth in panic and confusion. Sebastian suddenly rises. He crosses to the video camera and examines a small panel on the underneath of the camera. He reaches into a box of twinkies and pulls out one of the sponge cakes and begins munching. He hits the intercom button on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.0.) Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to the lab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.0.) Don't you sleep?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Waste of time. Da Vinci never slept.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frank eyes Sebastian in the monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He watches as Sebastian's heat signature moves toward the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. I'm here if you need me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the dark deserted lab, Sebastian pulls together a circuit board, a computer chip and some wiring. He seems be assembling something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian crosses underneath the camera... just out of its range... reaches up and using a screwdriver, unscrews the access panel. He scans the electronics and attaches two alligator clips to wires on the circuit board. Trailing a long length of wire, Sebastian crosses back to his bed and lies down. He holds a black project box with a button on it. He lies perfectly still and press the button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The video image of the Recovery Chamber flickers slightly, before returning to normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian rises and begins to peel off his latex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian's POV - Various animals stir restlessly. A DOG, visible, leaps against the Plexiglas, barking wildly. We push further down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, Sebastian's POV as he pushes through the open door of the observation room. We see Frank sorting through various computer readouts, highlighting certain coding sequences. We push in until we are looking over Frank's shoulder at the video monitor. According to the video, Sebastian is sleeping soundly in his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rewired security camera stares down at the empty bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank glances over at the video monitor. He can see Sebastian's heat signature lying in the bed. Frank feels something on his neck. He flicks whatever it is away with his hand and goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator door opens. The Guard turns around. The elevator is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .C. - NIGHT A Metro Subway train draws to a halt. With a cautionary "BING BONG" its doors slide open. A handful of people exit and enter. One man bumps shoulders. He turns round to apologize, but there's no one there. The doors close and the train pulls out of the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .C. - NIGHT A couple of pretty girls exit a bar and stumble to their apartments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the girls enters her apartment. The door half closes behind her and then reopens and closes again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank's reading a book when Linda and Matt enter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How'd it go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet. He worked in the lab till about 10:30 and then went to sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Close on the security camera. The wires have been removed and the access panel replaced. Sebastian whistles a cheerful tune as he finishes applying his makeup. The door opens and Linda and Matt enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda hands Sebastian a disk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, my two favorite people. Good morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why so cheery this morning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know some days you just wake up feeling the world is full of potential. Like your eyes have been opened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm happy if I make it to my coffee machine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I restructured the third genome on your radiated protein strand. Thought you might want to take look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cook up a batch and let's see where we go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you'd want to take a look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I trust you. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to have my head examined.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Linda pulls bags of frozen plasma from the shelves in the walk-in storage freezer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you, I know him. Something's going on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think he knows about us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he knew about us, he'd be angry and that wasn't angry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Janice heads up one of the corridors when something on the floor catches her eye. She bends down and takes a look at it. Barely visible on the floor is a fragment of a BAREFOOT FOOTPRINT. She runs her finger along the dried mud. It turns to dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian holds his latex head on his lap, while EEG leads hang suspended in mid-air, outlining his real head. Carter analyzes the results.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter pulls off the electrodes and Sebastian slides on his latex facemask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian gives Carter a sly grin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When you were a kid, you ever dream about being invisible?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure... all the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you imagine you'd do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The usual.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the usual?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hanging out in the girl's locker room. Kicking Jimmy Margiani's ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jimmy Margiani?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: School asshole. Drove a red Trans Am. Back then, I was the size of a small planet and made a rather large target.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ever think up anything along the grand scale?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. World domination. Manipulating stock markets, consolidating a political power base. But those are more recent fantasies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what if it weren't fantasy? What if you were out there in the world and could do whatever you wanted with no consequences whatsoever. How far would go? I mean... if it were real?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, man. Out in the real world... I mean, there's a responsibility...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's say you saw a woman with amazing tits. Would you brush against them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell, I try and do that now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Human nature. So if you could get away with more, would you do more?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I read that in a survey at a major university they asked college students "Would you steal if you were guaranteed to get away with it?" 82% said yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eighty two percent? Makes you wonder if the world's ready for what we're doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, Doc what did you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When you were out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just walked around. Y'know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, you just walked around? Come on. There's more, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Man, I'd be walking up to people saying shit like "This is God, go,get a haircut." Or hanging out in the changing room at Victoria's Secret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of sophomoric, don't you think. Besides, it was late and I wasn't out that long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, did you see anybody?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was this one girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? And did you mess with her? SEBASTIAN Naw...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Well maybe a little. (beat) I tell you though, a man could get used to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alone, Linda packs up her stuff for the evening. Slowly we push in on her and hear quiet breathing. We realize we are in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda-jumps.

direction.raw_text: As Kramer runs, he looks behind him. But no one's there. WHAM! Something slams into Kramer and he tumbles, rolling into the pool. But as he hits water there's not just one splash, but TWO. In the water next to him is human shaped AIR-POCKET. It's Sebastian displacing the water. And because of the water displacement, we can clearly see two arms pushing Kramer beneath the water's surface. MARTHA KRAMER opens the bedroom window and looks down at the pool. All she can see is her husband drowning... his flailing limbs kicking up a massive air bubble around him. She races from the window. Kramer kicks and flails for a few moments and then his limbs stop moving. A moment later he floats to surface, face down. The AIR POCKET bobs over to the pool ladder, and rising from the pool, we see Sebastian's body outlined in sheets of water. The shape melts away in a cascading waterfall until all we can see of Sebastian are the hundreds of tiny droplets still clinging to his body, caught in the light like twinkling bulbs on a Christmas tree. The shape disappears into the darkness. A moment later Martha emerges from the house and sees her husband floating face down in the pool. She screams.

direction.raw_text: Matt turns to face the corridor. It's turning red. Matt sees some movement in the thermal cloud. Opens fire. But the thermal signature disappears into the heat. Matt can't distinguish anything through his goggles anymore. He pulls them off and holds him gun in front of him sweeping the hallway.

direction.raw_text: Matt sweeps his front leg back and forth, like a blind man using a cane. But his foot isn't hitting anything. He sees a FIRE EXTINGUISHER mounted on the wall. He rushes it, turns it on the hallway and sprays. And SOMETHING LUNGES through the foam. GRABS HIM, sending him tumbling down the tunnel. Matt is thrown against the wall. Blood coming from his brow. He scrambles away, spraying more foam. Sees a shape in the mist, raises his pistol and FIRES. The shape leaps away. The DART FLIES. Doesn't hit. Matt scrambles back into a corner. His pistol is empty.

direction.raw_text: Sarah exits the lab. Checks the corridor. Down at the end of the cramped tunnel is the supply room. She swallows her fear and heads toward it, all the while glancing side-to-side and behind her.

direction.raw_text: Matt and Linda push along the corridor; Matt spraying with the fire extinguisher in short controlled bursts, Linda clutching her tranquilizer like a commando. A noise behind them. Footsteps. Matt turns to blast with the extinguisher. The white chemical dust sprays out, outlining a shape in the tunnel. But it isn't a human shape. Matt's uniform shreds. Something with fierce sharp claws fells him. Tearing into his flesh. We see a angry, hungry face... jabbing for a moment through the lingering fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Linda tries to get a clear shot off through the smoke. Matt trips and goes sprawling. Something yelps. A howl. Linda shoots. Her dart jabs into something which collapses to the ground. A moment of calm. As the dusty chemical foam settles, the outline of a great ape appears, still twitching.

direction.raw_text: Linda leans against the wall, still clutching her tranq gun at the ready. The heat is getting to bar. Bar scrubs are soaked, her hair's a mess. She wipes the sweat from her brow.

direction.raw_text: Sarah finishes collecting blood bags and shuts the door to the fridge/freezer. The DOOR SLAMS behind her. She freezes and slowly turns.

direction.raw_text: She eyes the supply room, looking for a sign of movement.

direction.raw_text: She listens. Is that breathing she hears? Now she's starting to panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to back away, but she's already in the corner. She clutches her tranquilizer gun, but there's nothing to aim at. The vials of blood on the shelf gives her an idea. She reaches over, grabs a vial and throws it on the floor. GLASS SHATTERS and BLOOD SMEARS across the linoleum. Sarah tosses another vial and another. Becoming more and more hysterical. Splattering more and more blood. But she runs out of vials. Shaking with fear, she searches the blood looking for a footprint, or movement. But there's nothing there. Sarah waits a beat, clutching the tranquilizer gun. Takes a step. Waits a beat longer. Finally she relaxes. It was just her imagination. She heads toward the door when she hears a terrifying whisper in her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her hair flies up, and she swings against the wall. She tries to move, but she's pinned there. Her hands struggling against the force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The arm holding the tranquilizer gun begins to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah fights, but her arm moves nonetheless
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly, deliberately, her own arm moves down the wall and around, until the tranquilizer gun points right at her stomach. Sarah watches in horror as her own body betrays her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She struggles, shaking back and forth. Writhing. In anguish and in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trigger pulls .... Pop! A dart explodes from the gun and imbeds in Sarah's stomach. She whimpers as her eyes glass over. Suddenly she's released. She stumbles backward and falls lifeless to the floor. A moment of stillness, all we can hear is the sound of someone breathing. On Sarah's face... a slight-indentation runs down her cheek.. Almost sweet... almost tender. And slight indentation runs across her breast and strokes down her body. The sense of violation and vulnerability is awful. Sebastian sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah's head shifts slightly. Her head shifts violently, accompanied by the celery crunch of her neck snapping. Sebastian exhales, his breath filled with the intoxication of power.
